intro: Amaracarpus montanus, commonly known as the mountain amara, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. The leaves are ovate with a smooth texture and are arranged alternately along the stem.
